title: Ribena Script
content:
Can anybody tell me the name of the script used on this pic? Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140320151656im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Ribenascript%5B6)
\_3533.jpg]

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Ribenascript[6].jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140320151656/http:/typophile.com/files/Ribenascript%5B6%5D.jpg) | 123.13 KB |
author: caledonianroad

comments.content:
Fertigo from exljbris is very close - also not at all bad for a Free font.

[http://www.josbuivenga.demon.nl/fertigo.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20140320151656/http:/www.josbuivenga.demon.nl/fertigo.html "http://www.josbuivenga.demon.nl/fertigo.html")
Thanks Mukhtar, but that's not it. I meant the script typeface used for Pure Juices, Nutritional Info, About Ribena etc.
If no one finds it, [Gizmo](http://web.archive.org/web/20140320151656/http:/www.type.co.uk/index.php?p=a_to_z_listing&let=*&id=11238) by Nick Cooke might be a nice alternative.

At first glance I thought it WAS Gizmo. Somebody has obviously taken Gizmo and completely reworked it. There are certain characteristics of this font that are the same as Gizmo. It is has been altered enough to be a different typeface, but basically, it is my handwriting - altered.

It is too coincidentally close to Gizmo to be the handwriting of somebody else. And with a similar pen.

I am NOT AT ALL HAPPY about this. I will get to the bottom of it.

Nick Cooke

Ps I am used to seeing slight alterations, (mainly the lower case r), but this takes it to a different level.
